content.text: Fatima buys \(20\mathrm{kg}\) of bananas and receives a discount of \(14\%
How much does she spend on bananas?
Fatima spends \(16.40 on apples after a discount of 18%
Calculate the original price of the apples
The ratio number of bananas : number of apples = 4 : 5
Fatima buys bananas and apples for the camp
The cost to hire a tent consists of two parts
The total cost for 4 days is \(27.10 and for 7 days is\) 34.30
Write down two equations in \(c\) and \(d\) and solve them
The children travel \(270\mathrm{km}\) to the camp, leaving at 07 43 and arriving at 15 13
Calculate their average speed in km/h
Two years ago \(\)540\(was put in a savings account to pay for the holiday
The account paid compound interest at a rate of \(6\%\) per year
How much is in the account now?
Children go to camp on holiday
Show that \(\mathrm{f}(x) = \mathrm{g}(x)\) can be written as \(4x^{2} - 3x - 2 = 0.\)
Show all your working and give your answers correct to 2 decimal places
Describe fully the **single** transformation that maps triangle \(T\) onto triangle \(A\)
Draw the image of triangle \(T\) after a rotation of \(90^{\circ}\) anticlockwise about the point (0,0)
Draw the image of triangle \(T\) after a reflection in the line \(x + y = 0\)
Draw the image of triangle \(T\) after an enlargement with centre (4, 5) and scale factor 1.5
Triangle \(T\) has its vertices at co-ordinates (2, 1), (6, 1) and (6, 3)
Draw this image on the grid and label it \(E\)
Describe fully the **single** transformation represented by the matrix \(\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 1 & 1 \end{pmatrix}\)
Write down the matrix that transforms triangle \(B\) onto triangle \(T\)
Triangles \(T\) and \(A\) are drawn on the grid above
How many biscuits can he make?
How many grams of butter does he need to make this number of biscuits?
Boris has only 350 grams of oatmeal but plenty of the other ingredients
The ingredients are mixed together to make dough
This dough is made into a sphere of volume \(1080 \mathrm{~cm}^3\)
Calculate the radius of this sphere
[The volume, \(V,\) of a sphere of radius \(r\) is \(V = \frac{4}{3}\pi r^{3}.]\)
How many whole biscuits can he cut from this cuboid?
Calculate the volume of dough left over
The \(1080\mathrm{cm}^3\) of dough is then rolled out to form a cuboid \(20\mathrm{cm}\times 30\mathrm{cm}\times 1.8\mathrm{cm}\)
Boris cuts out circular biscuits of diameter 5 cm
Boris has a recipe which makes 16 biscuits
The times, \(t\) seconds, for 200 people to solve a problem are shown in the table

table.html:
Time (t seconds)Frequency
0 < t 206
20 < t 4012
40 < t 5020
50 < t 6037
60 < t 7042
70 < t 8050
80 < t 9028
90 < t 1005

content.text: Calculate an estimate of the mean time
Complete the cumulative frequency table for this data
Draw the cumulative frequency graph on the grid opposite to show this data
how many people took between 65 and 75 seconds to solve the problem,
how many people took longer than 45 seconds to solve the problem
Use your cumulative frequency graph to find
Calculate the curved surface area of the cone
[The curved surface area, \(A\), of a cone, radius \(r\) and slant height \(l\) is \(A = \pi r l\).]
Calculate the value of \(h\), the vertical height of the cone
Calculate the **vertical** height of this small cone
Calculate the curved surface area of this small cone
Sasha cuts off the top of the cone, making a smaller cone with diameter 3 cm
This cone is **similar** to the original cone
The shaded solid from **part (b)** is joined to a solid cylinder with diameter 9 cm
Calculate the **total** surface area of the whole solid
A solid cone has diameter \(9\mathrm{cm}\), slant height \(10\mathrm{cm}\) and vertical height \(h\mathrm{cm}\)
On the grid, draw the graph of \(y = \mathrm {f}(x)\) for \(-3\leqslant x< 0.\)
By drawing a tangent, work out an estimate of the gradient of the graph where \(x = 2\)
Write down the inequality satisfied by \(k\) when \(\mathrm {f}(x)=k\) has three answers
Draw the line \(y = 1 - x\) on the grid for \(-3\leqslant x\leqslant 3.\)
Use your graphs to solve the equation \(1 - x = \frac{1}{x} + x^{2}\)
Rearrange \(x^{3} - x^{2} - 2x + 1 = 0\) into the form \(\frac{1}{x} +x^{2} = ax + b\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers
Write down the equation of the line that could be drawn on the graph
The diagram shows the accurate graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\) where \(\mathrm{f}(x) = \frac{1}{x} + x^2\) for \(0 < x \leqslant 3\)
Calculate the length of \(BC\) and show that it rounds to \(3.58 \mathrm{~m}\), correct to 2 decimal places
You must show all your working
Calculate the area of the canvas
Parvatti uses the canvas to give some shade
She attaches corners \(A\) and \(D\) to the top of vertical poles, \(AP\) and \(DQ\), each of height \(2\mathrm{m}\)
Corners \(B\) and \(C\) are pegged to the horizontal ground
\(AB\) is a straight line and angle \(BPA = 90^{\circ}\)
Pavatti has a piece of canvas \(ABCD\) in the shape of an irregular quadrilateral
exactly one of the 3 buttons is blue
Emile lost 2 blue buttons from his shirt
A bag of spare buttons contains 6 white buttons and 2 blue buttons
Emile takes 3 buttons out of the bag at random **without replacement**
Write down the number of buttons in the bag which are **not** blue
There are 25 buttons in another bag
Two buttons are taken at random **without replacement**
The probability that they are both blue is \(\frac{7}{100}\)
